meaningMnemonic:
This is like saying "when it comes to the 何故," which means you're giving a reason, making this <vocabulary>because</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>the reason is</vocabulary>, followed by… whatever you wanna say! 

Note that this is a quite formal way to say "because," so you'll mostly encounter this in writing or formal speech, and almost always at the beginning of a sentence in Japanese.
readingMnemonic: This reading is an exception but you learned them already because they're the same as the word 何故, which you learned a few levels ago. It just has some kana attached to it!
